description.narrative: In 2017, 20% of services attending childhood and adolescence have models and/or protocols that ensure quality attention with emphasis on children and adolescents from the first quintile., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children and adolescents enjoy higher levels of social inclusion, have better development opportunities, gain access to quality services and have their opinions heard, thereby helping to reduce the gap between the poorest 20% of the population and the wealthiest 20%.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Chile (Crisis and Emergencies)
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans

UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework

UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2017, 20% of services attending childhood and adolescence have models and/or protocols that ensure quality attention withemphasis on children and adolescents from the first quintile.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Social Development incorporated a child rights-based approach into the process of evaluation and monitoring of social services, based on a tool especially developed by UNICEF Chile for this purpose. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/12/2017

title.narrative: Specific training models with a rights approach, available and validated, for undergraduate training and for persons responsible for implementing childhood policies.

baseline.value: There are no comprehensive training models on the rights approach, validated and in use, for undergraduate training and for persons responsible for implementing childhood policies. Study by UNICEF and
